plants.name: Echinacea purpurea
plants.description: A perennial herbaceous flowering plant native to North America, known for its distinctive purple-pink petals surrounding a prominent spiny central cone. It thrives in prairies and open woodlands and is popular in gardens for attracting pollinators.
plants.funFact: Purple Coneflower is widely used in herbal remedies and is believed to boost the immune system.

plants.name: Dahlia pinnata
plants.description: A tuberous perennial plant native to Mexico, famous for its large, vibrant, and diverse flower forms and colors. Dahlias are popular ornamental plants often blooming late summer to fall, before the first frost.
plants.funFact: Dahlias are the national flower of Mexico and were originally cultivated by the Aztecs.

plants.name: Rhododendron ferrugineum
plants.description: A low-growing evergreen shrub found in the Alps and Pyrenees, producing clusters of pink to red bell-shaped flowers. It blooms in late summer to early fall at high altitudes.
plants.funFact: Despite its beauty, Alpenrose is toxic if ingested due to grayanotoxins.

plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: A widely cultivated herbaceous perennial known for its abundant and colorful daisy-like flowers, chrysanthemums bloom in autumn and are a symbol of longevity and rejuvenation in many cultures.
plants.location: Native to East Asia, widely cultivated globally
plants.funFact: In Japan, chrysanthemums are celebrated annually during the 'Festival of Happiness'.
